intro: Tulipa gesneriana var. albo-oculta, commonly known as the White Veined Tulip, is a hybrid tulip species characterized by its unique floral structure. It features large, cup-shaped blooms with white petals that have subtle, faintly visible veins, giving it a delicate and elegant appearance. The plant is native to the Netherlands and is prized for its ornamental value in gardens. It typically grows to a height of 15–20 inches and produces vibrant flowers in spring. This variety is well-suited for rock gardens and borders, thriving in well-drained soil and full sun.
